newsitem.title: FINLAND: HELSINKI BOURSE SEEN RISING AFTER U.S. SURGE.
newsitem.headline: HELSINKI BOURSE SEEN RISING AFTER U.S. SURGE.

text.p: Helsinki shares were seen opening
higher on Tuesday and rising some two percent or even more for
the day after the Dow ended at a new all-time high close in New
York overnight, brokers said.
Some brokers expected the bourse to jump at the opening.
"We will rise at least two percent at the start," one said.
Others were more cautious, but even then predicted the HEX
index would rise by close to two percent for the day.
Forestries and Nokia were likely to lead shares
higher after overnight gains in the U.S., brokers said.
Engineering group Rauma's first quarter profit was
in line with forecasts and brokers said the share could rise as
UPM-Kymmene's move to reduce its stake in Rauma was expected to
boost liquidity in the share and make it more attractive.
Data systems group TT Tieto was seen rising on its
Q1 profit that was near the top of the range of analysts'
forecasts, brokers said.
Sporting equipment and tobacco group Amer was
suspended pending a release at 1300/1000 GMT.
Brokers said Rautaruukki was likely to be in focus
with the 13 million shares sold in its share offering being
traded on the bourse for the first day.
--Helsinki Newsroom +358-9-680 50 235, news@reuters.fi
